HTTP#

A SelfBotClient.http It mainly handles requests to discord or detect ratelimit.#

class SelfBotClient.http.CustomSession(logger, *args, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: ClientSession

Parameters:

  • logger (Logger) –

  • args (Any) –

  • kwargs (Any) –

await get(url, *, allow_redirects=True, **kwargs)[source]#

The get function is a wrapper for the get function in the ClientSession class. It allows us to use asyncio’s await syntax, which makes it easier to write asynchronous code. The get function takes a url and returns an object of type ClientResponse.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • url (str) – str: Specify the url to be requested

  • * – Unpack the tuple and the ** parameter is used to unpack the dictionary

  • allow_redirects (bool) – bool: Determine whether the client will follow redirects

  • **kwargs –

    Any: Pass in any additional parameters that are not specified

Return type:

ClientResponse

Returns:

A clientresponse object

await request(method, url, **kwargs)[source]#

The request function is a wrapper around the ClientSession.request function, which handles ratelimits and other exceptions that may occur during requests. It also adds an additional cooldown to the Retry-After header value.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • method (str) – str: Determine the type of request

  • url (str) – str: Specify the url that you want to make a request to

  • **kwargs –

    Any: Pass in additional parameters to the request function

Return type:

ClientResponse

Returns:

A clientresponse object

class SelfBotClient.http.HTTPClient(api_version, loop=None, logger=True, request_latency=0.1, ratelimit_additional_cooldown=10)[source]#

Bases: object

Parameters:

  • ratelimit_additional_cooldown (float) –

await create_session()[source]#

The create_session function is used to create a new session for the bot. This function is called when the bot starts up, and also when it needs to reconnect. The session object contains all of the information about how many requests have been made, and how long until more can be made.

Parameters:

self – Refer to the current instance of a class

Return type:

None

Returns:

None

await request(url, method, headers=None, data=None)[source]#

The request function is used to send a request to the API.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • url (str) – str: Specify the url of the request

  • method (Literal['GET', 'POST', 'DELETE', 'PATCH', 'PUT']) – METHOD: Specify the type of request being sent

  • headers (dict) – dict: Pass in a dictionary of headers to be sent with the request

  • data (dict) – dict: Send data to the server

Return type:

ClientResponse

Returns:

A clientresponse object

run_async(function)[source]#

The run_async function is a helper function that allows you to run an asyncio coroutine in the background. It takes a single argument, which must be an awaitable object (such as a coroutine). It runs the event loop until the awaitable completes and then returns. This is useful for running tasks in parallel with other code.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the attributes and methods of a class

  • function (Awaitable) – Awaitable: Specify the type of the parameter function

Return type:

None

Returns:

None
